text: See More » Nantucket Island Resorts has a partnership with BMW for three of its properties on the island. At the Wauwinet, guests of the Coatue Suite can use a BMW M4 for the length of their stay. At White Elephant Village Inn, guests at the three-bedroom residences or penthouses can borrow either a BMW 4-Series or 5-Series, and those staying in the Easy Street Loft at the White Elephant have access to a BMW X1. TEE TIME IN MARRAKESH Golfing in Marrakesh? The new golf package from Royal Mansour , a hotel owned by the country’s monarch King Mohammed VI, is an unexpected way to experience the destination. Travelers can choose among five different courses, all outside the medina, the old city. One is 27 holes, the rest are 18 holes. The offer includes four rounds of golf, three nights in a one-bedroom riad with a private plunge pool, breakfast, a dinner for two at the on-site French restaurant, one spa treatment per person and fast-track service for airport arrival and departure. Prices from $3,450. Available from Sept. 15 to Dec. 23. CHEESE, WINE AND AUTUMN LEAVES IN QUEBEC New England might be a favorite fall getaway to see picturesque foliage, but Quebec’s countryside has equally spectacular viewing. Manoir Hovey, a Relais & Chateaux property 90 minutes southeast of Montreal, is surrounded by these changing colors and has a new culinary-themed package in celebration of the season. Called “Chants, Cheeses and Wine,” it includes breakfast, a picnic on the grounds of a nearby abbey, a tour and tasting at the organic winery Domaine Bergeville, a tasting at a local cheesemaker and a four-course dinner at the hotel’s fine-dining restaurant called Le Hatley. Prices from 500 Canadian dollars (about $395) per person, per night. A NEW RETREAT IN THE RHONE VALLEY M. Chapoutier, the renowned winery in the Rhone Valley of France, has welcomed visitors for tastings and tours for more than two decades. Now, for the first time, it’s offering them a place to spend the night with three new guesthouses, called gîtes. The winemaker Michel Chapoutier and his wife, Corinne, designed the homes, which have simple, contemporary furnishings and full kitchens. They’re in the midst of the vineyards and feature views of the Rhone Valley and the Rhone River. Two also have pools. Two-night stays start at $214. Loading...
